Content.Text:
<FACE_REBECCA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now I'll explain about your studio.
This is it!

<FACE_REBECCA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
In the studio, you can make things
out of various supplies you've acquired,
and place them wherever you want.

<FACE_REBECCA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now, let's check out the interior.
Take a look around the studio, <MYNAME>!

When you enter the studio, the studio
menu will pop up.
From the <RED>Blueprints<RED> menu, you can
choose to make <GREEN>house</GREEN> or <GREEN>town amenities</GREEN>
or <GREEN>tools</GREEN> to use on your farm.
The amenities you make can be placed
on the map using the <RED>Edit</RED> menu.
Now I'll show you what happens after
you choose the Blueprints menu.

The top screen shows the blueprint and
the supplies you will need to make it.

Making things from blueprints requires
lumber, stone, plants, and many other
materials, so collect these
items whenever you can.

On the lower screen is a list of the
blueprints you have acquired so far.

If you want to make something, select
a blueprint and press the <BLUE>A Button</BLUE>.

If you don't have the necessary
supplies, it will show you how many of
what materials you need to do the job.

And that's how the studio works.

Now, why don't you try making an
Architect's House for starters?

<FACE_REBECCA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
To build something, you need a <RED>blueprint</RED>
and <RED>materials</RED>.
<PAGE>
To get you started, I'll give you the
blueprint for a house to build now, and
small rocks and branches I collected.
